User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user within the application, with different roles (admin, manager, coach, athlete).

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

email.description: The email address of the user.

role.description: The role of the user (admin, manager, coach, athlete).

disabled.description: Indicates if the user's account is disabled.

Athlete.description: Represents an athlete associated with the club.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Athlete entity.

emergencyContactPhone.description: Phone number of the emergency contact.

medicalInformation.description: Important medical information about the athlete.

vo2max.description: Consumo máximo de oxígeno, medido en niveles de 1 a 30.

Payment.title: Payment
Payment.description: Represents a payment made by an athlete.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Payment entity.

paymentDate.description: The date when the payment was made.

Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task assigned to a coach or staff member.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Task entity.

assignerId.description: Reference to User who assigned the task. (Relationship: User 1:N Task (assigned))

assigneeId.description: Reference to User who is assigned to the task. (Relationship: User 1:N Task (assignee))

dueDate.description: The date when the task is due.

status.description: The status of the task (e.g., Open, In Progress, Completed).

id.description: Unique identifier for the LandingPageContent entity.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to manage a sports club (Opita Club Manager) with role-based access control. It prioritizes authorization independence by denormalizing clubId into every collection that requires club-specific data, eliminating the need for `get()` calls in security rules and enabling atomic operations.

- `/clubs`: Stores club details. This top-level collection allows easy querying for clubs.
- `/users`: Stores user details, including their role and clubId. This enables role-based access control at the user level.
- `/clubs/{clubId}/athletes`: Stores athlete information related to a specific club. The clubId is denormalized to enable secure querying of athletes within a club without requiring a `get()` call to the clubs collection. This supports QAPs by ensuring that listing athletes is secure and efficient.
- `/clubs/{clubId}/payments`: Stores payment information for athletes within a specific club. The clubId is denormalized here as well, ensuring secure and efficient payment listing.
- `/clubs/{clubId}/tasks`: Stores tasks assigned to coaches or staff within a club. The clubId is denormalized.
- `/clubs/{clubId}/landingPageContent`: Stores landing page content specific to each club. The clubId is denormalized.

This structure facilitates secure and efficient data retrieval and management, aligning with the application's role-based access control requirements and the need for an informative landing page.
